minmax_en.description: enable built-in min-max pixel filter, tier 1 enable
minmax_en.additional_notes: if BPC module is on, this feature is likely off

dirsmth_en.description: enable Directional Smoothing filter, tier 1 enable

cross_plane_en.description: enable Gr/Gb cross processing in bilateral filtering

dark_desat_en.description: enable dark desaturation feature, tier 2 enable

dark_smooth_en.description: enable dark area smoothing feature, tier 2 enable

act_adj_en.description: enable activity based adjustment feature, tier 2 enable
act_adj_en.additional_notes: It is effective only when both bilateral_en and dirsmth_en are set to 1

radial_anchor_tab.description: anchor tables from center to frame boundary
radial_anchor_tab.additional_notes: rnr_anchor[0] is 0 by default. normally rnr_anchor[4] is 1.0.

minmax_maxshft.description: upper/lower offset (as right-shifting) used in single bpc applied to neighbor pixels

minmax_minshft.description: upper/lower offset (as right-shifting) used in single bpc applied to neighbor pixels

minmax_offset.description: common absolute offset value used in single bpc applied to both center pixel and neighboring pixel

minmax_bls.description: black level used in single bpc applied to both center pixel and neighboring pixel

blkpix_lev_tab.description: block matching or pixel matching selection. Value 0 means block matching in determining filter coefficient. Value 4 means pixel matching

noise_std_lut_tab.description: noise profile (std) that will be used together with edge_softness to generate noise_std_dev_lut in packed format
noise_std_lut_tab.additional_notes: The above conversion starts with 8996 ABF noise profile

curve_offset_tab.description: offset that is subtracted from normalized difference before generating bilateral coefficients

dist_ker_tab.description: bit shifting value corresponding to distance weight; [0-2][] - 3 smoothing levels, [][0-2,R/B, 3-5,Gr/Gb] non-zero value n means 1-shift-left-(n-1); zero value means weight of 0.

edge_softness_tab.description: control bilateral filter strength together with noise_std_lut

denoise_strength_tab.description: higher means more denoising, one for each channel

noise_prsv_base_tab.description: base value for noise preserve, [0][] - R/B, [1][] - Gr/Gb

radial_edge_softness_adj_tab.description: base value for rnr, used for bilateral

radial_noise_prsv_adj_tab.description: base value for rnr, used for soft-thresholding

minmax_maxshft.description: upper/lower offset (as right-shifting) used in single bpc applied to neighbor pixels

minmax_minshft.description: upper/lower offset (as right-shifting) used in single bpc applied to neighbor pixels

minmax_offset.description: common absolute offset value used in single bpc applied to both center pixel and neighboring pixel

minmax_bls.description: black level used in single bpc applied to both center pixel and neighboring pixel
